Question: Why does dimenhydrinate have a greater risk for abuse and addiction while diphenhydramine does not?
Answer: Because the dopamine receptors for both drugs are located on the same part of the brain. Both drugs cause the same mental side-effects in most people, but diphenhydramine can be administered without a high risk for dependence and abuse. When it comes to abuse and dependence, the risk and severity of these side-effects are related to the dose of diphenhydramine. You can take much lower doses and still get high degrees of intoxication if you take it for even short periods of time.
